verses.kjv: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,
verses.web: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,
verses.ct: This letter is from Paul, called by God's will to be an apostle of Jesus Christ, and from our brother Sosthenes.

verses.kjv: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:
verses.web: to the assembly of God which is at Corinth—those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called saints, with all who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ in every place, both theirs and ours:
verses.ct: To the church of God in Corinth — those who have been set apart in Christ Jesus, called to be saints — along with everyone everywhere who calls on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, their Lord and ours:

verses.kjv: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
verses.web: I always thank my God concerning you, for the grace of God which was given you in Christ Jesus;
verses.ct: I always thank my God for you because of the grace he has given you through Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge;
verses.web: that in everything you were enriched in him, in all speech and all knowledge;
verses.ct: Through him you've been made rich in every way — in your speaking and in your knowledge.

verses.kjv: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:
verses.web: even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:
verses.ct: The truth about Christ has been firmly established among you,

verses.kjv: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.web: so that you come behind in no gift; waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ;
verses.ct: so that you aren't lacking any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to return.

verses.kjv: Who shall also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: who will also confirm you until the end, blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: He will also keep you strong to the very end, so that you'll be without blame on the day our Lord Jesus Christ comes back.

verses.kjv: God is faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.web: God is faithful, through whom you were called into the fellowship of his Son, Jesus Christ, our Lord.
verses.ct: God is faithful, and he's the one who called you into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.kjv: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verses.web: Now I beg you, brothers, through the name of our Lord, Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfected together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verses.ct: Brothers, I urge you in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ: agree with one another. Don't let there be divisions among you. Instead, be united — sharing the same mind and the same purpose.

verses.kjv: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them which are of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.
verses.web: For it has been reported to me concerning you, my brothers, by those who are from Chloe’s household, that there are contentions among you.
verses.ct: I say this because people from Chloe's household have told me that you're arguing among yourselves, my brothers.

verses.kjv: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.
verses.web: Now I mean this, that each one of you says, “I follow Paul,” “I follow Apollos,” “I follow Cephas,” and, “I follow Christ.”
verses.ct: What I mean is that each of you is picking sides, saying, "I follow Paul," or "I follow Apollos," or "I follow Cephas," or "I follow Christ."

verses.kjv: Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?
verses.web: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized into the name of Paul?
verses.ct: Can Christ be divided up like that? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized in Paul's name?

verses.kjv: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;
verses.web: I thank God that I baptized none of you, except Crispus and Gaius,
verses.ct: I thank God that I didn't baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

verses.kjv: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.
verses.web: so that no one should say that I had baptized you into my own name.
verses.ct: so no one can claim they were baptized in my name.

verses.kjv: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.
verses.web: (I also baptized the household of Stephanas; besides them, I don’t know whether I baptized any other.)
verses.ct: (I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Beyond that, I don't remember baptizing anyone else.)

verses.kjv: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.
verses.web: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the Good News—not in wisdom of words, so that the cross of Christ wouldn’t be made void.
verses.ct: After all, Christ didn't send me to baptize — he sent me to preach the gospel. And not with clever rhetoric, either, because that would drain the cross of Christ of its power.

verses.kjv: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
verses.web: For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are dying, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.ct: The message of the cross sounds like nonsense to those who are headed for destruction, but to us who are being saved, it is the power of God.

verses.kjv: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.
verses.web: For it is written, “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise. I will bring the discernment of the discerning to nothing.”
verses.ct: As Scripture says: "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and I will sweep aside the intelligence of the intelligent."

verses.kjv: Where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disputer of this world? hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
verses.web: Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the lawyer of this world? Hasn’t God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
verses.ct: So where does that leave the philosopher? The scholar? The skilled debater of this age? God has turned the world's wisdom into foolishness.

verses.kjv: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
verses.web: For seeing that in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom didn’t know God, it was God’s good pleasure through the foolishness of the preaching to save those who believe.
verses.ct: Since the world, with all its wisdom, failed to know God, he was pleased to use what the world considers foolish preaching to save everyone who believes.

verses.kjv: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:
verses.web: For Jews ask for signs, Greeks seek after wisdom,
verses.ct: Jews demand miraculous signs, and Greeks go looking for wisdom,

verses.kjv: But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;
verses.web: but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews, and foolishness to Greeks,
verses.ct: but we preach Christ crucified — an offense to Jews and absurdity to Greeks.

verses.kjv: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
verses.web: but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God;
verses.ct: Yet to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.

verses.kjv: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.web: because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.ct: Because what seems foolish in God is wiser than human wisdom, and what seems weak in God is stronger than human strength.

verses.kjv: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, are called:
verses.web: For you see your calling, brothers, that not many are wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, and not many noble;
verses.ct: Think about your own calling, brothers. Not many of you were considered wise by human standards. Not many were powerful. Not many came from important families.

verses.kjv: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;
verses.web: but God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise. God chose the weak things of the world that he might put to shame the things that are strong.
verses.ct: Instead, God chose what the world considers foolish to put the wise to shame. He chose what the world considers weak to put the strong to shame.

verses.kjv: And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen, yea, and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:
verses.web: God chose the lowly things of the world, and the things that are despised, and the things that don’t exist, that he might bring to nothing the things that exist,
verses.ct: God chose what is low and looked down on in this world — things considered nothing at all — to overthrow what the world considers something.

verses.kjv: That no flesh should glory in his presence.
verses.web: that no flesh should boast before God.
verses.ct: He did this so that no one could ever boast in his presence.

verses.kjv: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:
verses.web: Because of him, you are in Christ Jesus, who was made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification, and redemption:
verses.ct: It is because of God that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God — and our righteousness, our sanctification, and our redemption.

verses.kjv: That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
verses.web: that, as it is written, “He who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.”
verses.ct: So as Scripture says, "Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord."
